alert.note: Alert for Albany (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 05 at 2:03PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall from stationary thunderstorms. * WHERE...A portion of Albany County in Wyoming including the Mullen Burn Scar. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in eastern portions of the Mullen Burn Scar. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 200 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms on the east side of the Mullen Burn Scar. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in Collins Creek, Lake Creek, and Fox Creek. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Collins Creek, Lake Creek, and Fox Creek is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Albany, Lake Owen, Lake Owen Campground, Bobbie Thompson Campground, Miller Lake Campground, Evans Creek Campground, Rob Roy Reservoir, Rob Roy Campground, Woods Landing-Jelm and Woods Landing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
